sections.title: What You'll Learn
items: How to translate big dreams into Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound goals
Ways to stack goals without derailing essential needs
How cash flow and automation keep goals on track
What to monitor monthly so you can adjust early

sections.title: Build SMART Goals That Stick
sections.content: Dreams become reality when you turn them into SMART goals. Be specific about the target (for example, $9,000 for travel), measurable with a dollar amount or percentage, achievable given your cash flow, relevant to your values, and time-bound with a clear deadline. Break large goals into checkpoints so progress feels achievable and motivating.

points.title: Prioritize the Essentials
points.description: Emergency funds, insurance, and high-interest debt typically take priority before aspirational goals.

points.title: Automate Contributions
points.description: Automatic transfers act like a bill you owe yourself and make skipping contributions less likely.

points.title: Review Monthly
points.description: A short review cadence catches missed deposits or cost overruns while they are still easy to fix.

sections.title: Micro-Wins Matter

sections.title: Activate Your Goals
steps: List three financial goals and rewrite each as a SMART statement.
Assign a target date and monthly contribution to every goal.
Automate transfers or calendar reminders for each monthly contribution.
Set a recurring 30-minute monthly meeting with yourself to review progress and adjust.

sections.title: Bundle Rewards
sections.content: Pair goal progress with small, low-cost rewards so momentum feels exciting and sustainable.
